intro: Plocama hymenostephana, commonly known as the Pacific pincushion, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, rounded, cushion-like growth habit. The plant produces small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink, often appearing in clusters at the tips of its stems. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its overall fluffy appearance. Plocama hymenostephana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal regions and high-elevation habitats.
